events.name: Future of Energy: Building the Grid on the Blockchain
events.description: Please register here, https://www.sginnovate.com/events/future-energy-building-grid-blockchain Future of Energy: Building the Grid on the Blockchain Presented by SGInnovate. Partnered With SP Group Blockchain—the technology that underpins bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies—has the potential to remake important aspects of the energy industry. The emergence of blockchain introduces a new measure of uncertainty at a time when the industry is changing rapidly due to renewable and distributed energy, energy efficiency, energy storage, and digitization. Given their potential to streamline transactions and cut costs, blockchain could help to remove pain points and friction throughout the power value chain. To unleash this potential, Energy Web Foundation (EWF), with support from some of the largest energy companies globally, was established to enable and accelerate the transition to a democratized, decentralized, decarbonized, and digitized electricity grid. SP Group is a Founding Affiliate of EWF and leading the development of one of the most compelling blockchain use cases in the energy sector with the world’s first blockchain powered Renewable Energy Certificate marketplace. Please join our Future of Energy session, presented by SGInnovate and in partnership with the SP Group, with Ewald Hesse, Vice-Chair of EWF as he shares his insights on the potential of energy blockchain technology. He will be joined by May Liew, Vice President of Innovation at SP Group as they discuss the global collaboration that EWF and SP Group has embarked on towards a clean and sustainable future enabled by blockchain technology. Date : 2 August 2018Time : 4:00pm – 5:30pmVenue : 32 Carpenter Street, Singapore 059911 Programme4:00pm – 4:15pm: Registration4:15pm – 4:30pm: Keynote by Ewald Hesse, Vice-Chair of Energy Web Foundation4:30pm – 5:00pm: Fireside chat with Ewald Hesse, Vice-Chair of Energy Web Foundation and May Liew, Vice President of Innovation, SP Group5:00pm – 5:30pm: Q&A and End Speakers:- Ewald Hesse, Vice-Chair, Energy Web Foundation- May Liew, Vice President of Innovation, SP Group

events.name: [RSVP required] The API Surgery: A 90 minute introduction to API Management
events.description: *Please note this is a ticketed event owing to event format* *RSVP via Peatix (https://api-surgery-aug.peatix.com/)* Got an API? Want to manage it better but don’t know where to start? Maybe you’re looking to release it to the world, but find the technical steps to get there a pain in the neck? Tyk’s here to help. (http://tyk.io/) Join us for a 90-minute API 'surgery' led by Tyk’s senior Solution Architect, David Garvey, (or, as we like to call him, our 'API Doctor'). It'll be a hands-on, technical workshop, with plenty of opportunities for Q&A, and all powered by open-source, pizza and drinks. All you’ll need to bring is your laptop and the URL to your API.* We’ll provide the rest (including our totally free open-source API gateway, either on-premises, or in the Tyk Cloud). By the end of the 90 minutes you will have: • Set up your API using the Tyk Gateway • Published a Developer Portal so that your API can be viewed by the world • Created API keys so that others can access it • Used policies to easily control API keys • Configured your API access settings, so that access to your API is always safe and secure • Understood how to read your API analytics • Benefitted from a hands-on approach so that you can continue to go forth and manage your API using Tyk’s free open-source software Please RSVP via Peatix. (https://api-surgery-aug.peatix.com/) Doors open at 1830 to allow laptop set-up and introductions for a 1900 start. The API surgery will close at 2030 but there’ll be time to ask final questions and mingle with your fellow API lovers until 2100. NB: This is a hands-on workshop with limited spaces to ensure you get the most out of the session with our API Doc. Grab a ticket to reserve your spot. Want to join but can't make this event? Contact us to let us know if you'd like us to repeat this event. *Not quite at the point where you have your API URL set-up? That's OK too, we'll provide a test URL that you can use, so you can start planning your own API operations.
events.location: Collision 8 High Street Centre, 1 North Bridge Road #08-08, Singapore

events.name: The Future of Work Tackling Talent Shortage with Remote Teams
events.description: Please register here, https://www.sginnovate.com/events/future-work-tackling-talent-shortage-remote-teams The Future of Work Tackling Talent Shortage with Remote Teams Presented by General Assembly. Partnered with SGInnovate More and more companies are looking for talent on a global level to power the digital transformation and employees are seeing the value and freedom of the digital nomad/remote work lifestyle. In this discussion we'll dive into practices of operating in different countries with teams of people working both remotely and in the office. Date : 2 August 2018Time : 7:00pm – 9:00pmVenue : 32 Carpenter Street, Singapore 059911 Programme:6:30pm - 7:00pm: Check-in & Networking7:00pm - 7:45pm: Panel/Lighting Talks7:45pm - 8:15pm: Q&A8:15pm - 9:00pm: Networking

events.name: Traffic Management with Istio -   Get easily, Set sleekly , Route smoothly
events.description: == Schedule7.00PM: meet for pizzas7.30PM: talk == SpeakerKamesh is Red Hat’s Director of Developer Experience. Kamesh is the creator of vertx-maven-plugin(https://vmp.fabric8.io) and he has been an active contributor to OpenSource projects like OpenWhisk, Eclipse Che, fabric8 etc.,. Being a OpenSource developer and contributor Kamesh's loves sharing his experience on building and deploying Java Applications on Kubernetes/OpenShift. == Talk: Traffic Management with Istio - Get easily, Set sleekly, Route smoothly in the Cloud The first generation of microservices was primarily shaped by Netflix OSS and leveraged by numerous Spring Cloud annotations all throughout your business logic. The next generation of microservices will leverage *sidecars and a service mesh*. In this session, we will give you a taste of Envoy and Istio, two open source projects that will change the way you write *Cloud Native, Java Applications on Kubernetes*. Service Mesh alleviates most of the common distributed computing pain points like smart routing, traffic splitting, canaries etc., In this session we will explore on how to download, setup Istio on your local laptop, deploy few Java Microservices as part of the Istio Service Mesh with Istio sidecar proxy. Istio Proxy sidecars will spice up the Cloud Native Applications with the ability in splitting traffic between various version of services, smart routing using request headers, doing chaos engineering and much more but ALL WITHOUT CODE REDEPLOYS.
events.location: Credit Agricole CIB – Polymorphic Room  , Mapletree Business City II, 80 Pasir Panjang Road #23, Singapore

events.name: Book Club: Challenges for Game Designers
events.description: Book club returns by popular demand ;) After the previous hardcore machine learning course, we are going to switch gears to read about game design: Challenges for Game Designers, by Brenda Brathwaite. You can get the book from Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/Challenges-Game-Designers-Brenda-Brathwaite/dp/158450580X/ We are meeting weekly, covering 2 topics (about 20-40 pages) per week. Same format as previous book club meetups: - Doors open 7pm. Meetup starts 7:30pm and usually runs to 9:00/9:30pm.- Bring dinner/snacks and/or eat beforehand.- Everyone who participates is expected to read the week's chapters beforehand.- We go around the room and everybody talks about one thing you find interesting and/or ask a question regarding the chapters read. Below is a list of all the topics we plan to cover: Week 1:The BasicsGame Design Atoms Week 2:Puzzle DesignConverting Digital to Physical Week 3:Elements of ChanceElements of "Strategic" Skill Week 4:Elements of "Twitch" SkillChance and Skill: Finding the Balance Week 5:Targeting a MarketLearning an Unfamiliar Genre Week 6:Designing a Game to Tell a StoryAdding and Subtracting Mechanics Week 7:"But Make It Multiplayer"Creating a User Interface Week 8:Games as ArtGames as a Teaching Tool Week 9Serious GamesCasual GamesSocial Networks and Games
events.location: Tim and Wei's Residence, #06-160, 9 Boon Keng Road, Singapore

events.name: NUS-ISS SkillsFuture Series Seminar: How AI is remodelling the world of banking and finance
events.description:
Artificial Intelligence is taking the financial services industry by storm. Many companies in the financial technology sector has already started using AI to save time, reduce costs, and add value. Through the use of AI algorithms, financial service companies is able to generate insights, improve customer service, and make predictions about company performance.The future of finance will be heavily influenced by emerging fintech companies and AI technology applications setting the stage for increasing competitiveness among the industry’s leading giants. In the next decade, Artificial Intelligence will help financial services companies maximize resources, decrease risk, and generate more revenue, in the trading, investing, banking, lending, and fintech verticals. 
Click here  for full programme

*Stay in touch with the latest from us! Sign up to receive emails on new courses, upcoming seminars, updates and more.
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615
